articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Cisco Systems (CSCO.O) on Thursday agreed to acquire cybersecurity company Splunk (SPLK.O) for about $28 billion, in its biggest acquisition ever that would bolster its network security business.
articles.title: Cisco beefs up cybersecurity play with $28 bln Splunk deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: As China's stock market struggles to recover, regulators have started to probe some hedge funds and brokerages on quantitative trading strategies amid a growing outcry against a sector able to profit from share price falls and volatility, sources said.
articles.title: Exclusive: China scrutinizes quant strategies as market weakness stokes public anger - sources

articles.author: Tom Hals
articles.description: A legal team that forced Tesla's (TSLA.O) directors to agree in July to return more than $700 million in compensation to the automaker for allegedly overpaying themselves are now seeking a huge payday of their own.
articles.title: Lawyers who sued Tesla board for excess pay want $10,000 an hour

articles.author: Rajesh Singh
articles.description: Travel boom has delivered bumper earnings for U.S. carriers, but no-frills airlines such as Frontier (ULCC.O) and Spirit (SAVE.N) are struggling to return to sustainable profitability.
articles.title: Focus: Travel boom not enough to drive profits at US budget airlines Frontier, Spirit

articles.author: Yena Park, Jihoon Lee, Cynthia Kim
articles.description: South Korea's major exporters of cars and smartphones are bringing home a bigger chunk of their earnings this year to enjoy new tax breaks, and their 'reshoring' has become one rare source of support for a depreciating currency.
articles.title: As Samsung and Hyundai repatriate more earnings, weak won gets some reprieve

articles.author: Steven Scheer
articles.description: Financial markets are hoping Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu keeps Bank of Israel Governor Amir Yaron for a second term to safeguard the bank's independence and provide reassuring stability to an economy rattled by political turmoil this year.
articles.title: Analysis: Amid Israel turmoil, markets want continuity at central bank helm

articles.author: Kevin Yao
articles.description: China's economic slowdown is polarising government advisers over the best way forward, with advocates of structural reforms now emerging from the shadows in a challenge to others calling for more state spending to shore up faltering growth.
articles.title: Analysis: China's economic woes embolden calls for deeper reforms

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: The United States Navy is carrying out the biggest overhaul of its top-secret undersea surveillance network since the end of the Cold War in an effort to contain the threat of China’s submarines. Beijing has similar plans of its own.
articles.title: U.S. revives Cold War submarine spy program to counter China

articles.author: Lisa Richwine
articles.description: "Set decorator for 20 years. Single mom of 15-year-old twins," said the sign above a table of cupcakes, cookies and other baked goods for sale. "Struggling to pay bills, especially my mortgage."
articles.title: Hollywood workers resort to flea markets, bake sales as strikes drag on

articles.author: Joe Cash
articles.description: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad has arrived in China's eastern city of Hangzhou, kicking off his first visit to the Asian nation since 2004 as he makes further strides to end more than a decade of diplomatic isolation amid Western sanctions.
articles.title: Syria's Assad in China, seeks exit from diplomatic isolation
